should they be introduced or not. It would be compulsary to carry them everywhere

why would you need to carry ID everywhere?
 when would you want a person to start (age)?

It is an idea present in several European countries, and there are plans to introduce it over here. The Home Office's stated reasons are:
 
 
 
From www.homeoffice.gov.uk
 To deter illegal working 
 To tackle immigration abuse 
 To strengthen security by disrupting the use of false and multiple identities by terrorists and organised crime groups 
 To ensure free public services are only used by those entitled to them 
 To help protect people from identity theft

 
 Not sure at the age of introduction.
 
 Personally I'm for them, I don't think it has any real reduction in civil liberties and has benifits in fighting crime.

I disagree with them. Didn't Spain have them before 11/3? Certainly didn't help them.
 
 Anyway I am innocent until proven guilty and I will not be treated as a suspected criminal in my own country.

It's not a case of being treated as a criminal, it would just greatly help the police and other services in determining identity quickly and efficiently.
 
 Do you object to carrying a driving licence on you when you drive (I think that's the law in the states)? It's the same thing really.
In all honesty my objection to ID cards could be passed off as paranoia. I do not trust humans in general and as such feel that there is great potental for abuse with ID cards.

Interesting, because the reason I support identity cards is that I do not trust humans in general and as such feel that the greater control and surveillance over them we have the easier it will be to stop their dishonesty!
